# Exercise 1: Making a function

```{r}

# Step 1: Load the necessary packages

library(tidyverse)
library(datateachr)
vancouver_trees

count_obs_by_variable <- function(df, grouped_var, summarized_var, na.rm = TRUE) {
  df |>
    group_by({{grouped_var}}) |>
    summarize(n = n(), mean = mean({{summarized_var}}), stdev = sd({{summarized_var}}), range = (max({{summarized_var}}) - min({{summarized_var}})))
}

# Step 2: Define the function

# Function name: count_obs_by_variable
# Purpose: Calculate a count of the number of observations of a specific variable in each category of a group
# ---INPUTS---
# x      A character vector
# na.rm  To remove or keep NA's before running function. Defaults to false - logical value.
# ...    Other arguments that get passed to the group_by() and count() functions

# ---OUTPUT---
# A dataframe with a count of the number of observations of one variable grouped by the categories of another variable.



nbhd_diam_summary <- count_obs_by_variable(vancouver_trees, neighbourhood_name, diameter)

nbhd_diam_summary
```
